Job description

IT Helpdesk Operator - Melbourne and Sydney

About Us

Named as the 2017 Law Firm of the Year at the Australasian Law Awards , Mills Oakley is an Australian commercial law firm experiencing significant growth. The firm is resourced by over 89 Partners and more than 650 staff in offices across Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Canberra and Perth. From origins in Melbourne in 1864, Mills Oakley has grown to become a leading national firm whose clients include ASX top 200 listed companies, mid-sized corporates, the public sector and not-for-profit organisations. Mills Oakley’s success has been driven by the energetic vision of the firm and our commitment to building strong, lasting relationships with clients.

The Role

Two new opportunities have arisen for IT Helpdesk support operators to work in our Melbourne and Sydney offices. We are looking for a driven, client focused candidate with a professional approach.

This role is responsible for the provision of timely, accurate and high quality IT support to the firm’s Partners and employees. You will be providing helpdesk, desktop and application support to internal staff across multiple sites nationally. This is a great opportunity to join this growing National firm and be trained in first to third level Support within a friendly working environment.

Who We Are Looking For

Both roles would suite a candidate with 1 to 2 years’ experience who is looking to further their career in a professional environment. We are looking for a team player who is client focused and has the ability to pick things up quickly. You will also have excellent written and verbal communication skills and high analytical and problem solving skills.

Apply
All applications can be addressed to Emma Weeber, Talent Acquisition Consultant and submitted online via our Career's Page.IT

Claims Consultant

Company Name Willis Towers Watson Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 58 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

High-performing institutions cultivate and grow talent, carefully balancing costs and rewards. From employee benefits to executive compensation, we take a rounded perspective, based on leading-edge thinking, data, analytics and software, unearthing new ways to motivate people, foster wellbeing and implement solutions that work.

\xa0

This role will be responsible for Life and Personal Accident claims advocacy though the provision of technical advice and support, settlement negotiations and problem solving. Proactively managing claims with carriers on behalf of clients, leveraging understanding of claims processes, procedures and laws. It will also provide general advice to clients on validity of claims and appropriate claim strategy and work in partnership with the Client Consultant (Health & Benefits) as required.

\xa0

This is a part-time role working three days per week which can be based either in Sydney or Melbourne.\xa0 There is flexibility around which days the successful candidate prefers.


The Role:


  • Oversee allocated claims or clients including major and complex claims

  • Provide advice and support to clients in the negotiation and settlement of a claim

  • Negotiate for clients with insurers

  • Engage with all parties to resolve coverage disputes through in-depth policy knowledge, current case law and industry practices and trends

  • Provide claims advice to clients and internal stakeholders in relation to: reporting & monitoring of claims activity, claims reviews/audits, advice on industry claims experience

  • Provide claims specific input to a client tender process (Request For Proposal), working with the client advocate

  • Provide technical expertise and mentoring to assist development of Claims Advisors and associates in Manila.

  • General administration as required

  • Collate and provide claims documentation to the insurer

  • Monitor claims progress to ensure follow up with insurers and timely resolution of the claim

  • Manage claims settlement and deductibility process to a finalised position

  • Communicate finalised position with clients

  • Monitor & confirm that clients are in receipt of claims settlements, either direct from insurer or through WTW

  • Monitors the end-to-end claims process to ensure high quality service is achieved

  • Provides structured data for the business to use to provide excellent service to our clients



The Requirements:

\xa0

  • Proven experience in claims management

  • Working towards a professional insurance qualification

  • Holds all regulatory licences, permissions and technical or other requirements applicable under local legislation

  • The ability to build strong relationships with clients, brokers and insurers

  • Excellent influencing, negotiation, presentation and communication skills

  • Ability to effectively present to clients and prospective clients your claims expertise

  • Extensive claims expertise in loss prevention/ claims mitigation techniques

  • Coaching and mentoring of team members

  • Competent in Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Excel and Word)

  • Extensive experience in all aspects of end to end claims process, specific process requirements and client and carrier engagement, including adjudication process/ procedures

  • Claims negotiation process

  • Comprehensive understanding of policy wording and coverage

  • Deep knowledge of (group life, salary continuance and personal accident), class claims and the law and case precedent applicable to this class





Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on any basis. \xa0 We support flexible working and this role will be considered on a flexible basis.

\xa0\xa0\xa0

Applicants must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or hold a valid and appropriate permanent working visa.

\xa0

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Payroll Manager

Exciting opportunity to run the payroll function for one of Australia’s leading Technology Consulting firms. Due a maternity leave vacancy we require an experienced Payroll Manager to run multiple payrolls nationally. This role has end to end responsibility for 4 separate payrolls across 4 business entities.


The role reports into the Group Financial Controller and sits within a collegiate finance team. The position will engage with stakeholders across the Group and will interact most regularly with the Group HR function. There are no direct reports.


The successful candidate will need to exhibit a strong attention to detail, the ability to meet deadlines and the ability to communicate effectively with various stakeholders. Specific responsibilities include:

There is a competitive salary package on offer in addition to an active Social Club and ongoing staff development. The role will be based in the Melbourne CBD.

Company Name Polyglot Group Company Location Melbourne

Job description

Melbourne is projected to have a population explosion to five million by 2021 and eight million by 2050 and while building the right infrastructure plays a major role to support that growth, integrating smart traffic management solutions has become just as critical. This is where you come in.

We’re assisting an international ITS integrator in finding them a Systems Engineer to get involved in one of Melbourne's largest traffic infrastructure projects. You’ll work on the development of the CCTV and AVID system architecture design as well as the implementation and configuration.

About the role:

Reporting to the Project Manager, you’ll work on the design of the traffic camera, video surveillance and AVID system architecture as well as the implementation and configuration, including:

- Sizeable and redundant CCTV system based on Genetec software
- Substantial CCTV recording system based on SAN redundant systems
- Latest technology IP CCTV cameras based in AXIS IP cameras
- AVIDS based on Citilog software
- Integration with Video Wall systems
- CCTV and AVIDS implementation and configuration
- Comprehensive testing all stages and final commissioning

Your experience & skills:

- Extensively experienced in designing and working with complex CCTV systems based on Genetec
- Knowledgeable experience with large CCTV recording systems
- Experience with AVIDS, in particular Citilog
- Experienced in the implementation of Control Room and Video Wall systems
- Experience with all-encompassing implementations based in multicast and Layer2/Layer3 protocols such as: PIM, IGMP, etc.
- Experienced in FAT, SAT and site commissioning activities
- Office Tools: Word, Excel, Visio, AutoCAD, etc
- Experience with OMCS (SCADA) and system integration would be a plus
- Ability to manage a small team of engineers
- Strong skills in documentation and quality processes

Further requirements:

- B.S. in Computer Systems, Electronics, ICT or Electrical/Mechanical Engineering
- At least 3 years of experience in planning, development, design, integration and delivery of ITS technology.
At least 2 years or more experience with Genetec Systems
- Experienced in working with AVID systems, in particular Citilog
- Valid Driver's Licence

You'll join an international team of engineering specialists and enable a smarter, safer journey for millions of Melburnians. If this sounds like a challenge you’re ready to take up and are interested in discussing further, please click “apply”.

Job description

Due to growth, we are on the lookout for an Area Manager to join a growing food retailer and wholesaler based in Melbourne's North & Western suburbs.\xa0


This is a newly created role meaning you will have the opportunity to develop and implement new processes and procedures. You will work with freedom and autonomy as you report to directors that really want you to invest in their business because they will invest in you!\xa0


You will get to work with a motivated team who are passionate about their brand and the services they provide. The business culture is laid back but they don't slack off. They want to go to work each and every day!


You can work close to home with head office based out of Sunshine. Not only is there flexibility to work from home but there is also an attractive remuneration package!\xa0

The role
\xa0

You will develop solid relationships with managers across 8 different stores and assist with staff training and development. These guys are growing so you will also see new stores added to your area, with the potential to move into a national management role.


You will implement processes and procedures, such as targets and training or development programs. You will work with Store Managers to drive sales and increase revenue, but at the same time ensure the high staff retention rates are maintained.\xa0


The company

These guys are a market leader in their field. You will join an established and successful yet still growing and growing fast. They have both a retail and wholesale side to their business. This means there are opportunities for growth in the future.

They are a one-stop shop for hundreds of their clients. With 8 cafes up and running, as well as 4 opening in the next 12 months, they are going from strength to strength.

Key requirements\xa0

  • Previous experience managing multiple hospitality venues or food retail stores

Finance Officer

Company Name Munro Footwear Group Company Location Port Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 198 views

Job description

Munro Footwear Group (MFG) is Australia's leading retailer and wholesaler of footwear, owning and operating Australia's most iconic brands. Our impressive portfolio includes Midas, Mollini, Mountfords, Wanted, Williams, Mathers, diana ferrari as well as Australia's most popular online footwear retailer, Styletread!


Due to an internal promotion we have an exciting opportunity for a proactive and motivated Finance Offer to join our dynamic and tight knit Finance Team!

Reporting to our Group Finance Manager, as our Finance Officer you will be primarily responsible for our daily bank reconciliation processes. This multifaceted role will see you taking ownership of tasks across banking, store support and administration in a team setting that is challenging, focused and collaborative.


Your responsibilities will include but not limited to:

  • Downloading bank statements daily and updating transaction details in the financial system
  • Ensuring bank accounts are reconciled daily and that all mismatched transactions are followed up in a timely manner
  • Match and code transactions from bank statements to GL
  • Perform bank account general ledger reconciliations on a monthly basis
  • Processing of credit card transactions monthly in the GL
  • Ensuring store takings are reconciled
  • Ensuring Layby, Zippay and Afterpay transactions are documented and payments are reconciled
  • Proactively work with stores to resolve banking issues
  • Maintain effective working relationships with banks to ensure any issues are promptly queried and followed-up

Our Benefits:

  • Generous Employee discount – up to 50% off all Munro Footwear products
  • Joining one of Australia's largest multi branded footwear retailers
  • Career development opportunities to grow your career!

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Currently studying or completed a bachelor's Degree in Finance / Accounting or equivalent
  • Proficient knowledge in Microsoft Office Applications; particularly Excel
  • Experience within retail or banking environment
  • Strong customer orientation and a preparedness to work with and through others to achieve results
  • Exceptional organisational skills and demonstrate high attention to detail and accuracy
  • The ability to multitask and prioritise tasks to meet deadlines
  • Great initiative, always looking for ways to improve processes and outcomes
  • Confidence to contact key stakeholders across stores, banks and others to resolve matters
  • Strong ability to think outside the square and value continuous improvement

If you are an enthusiastic and ambitious Finance student or recent graduate with a keen interest in developing your career, this is an exciting role to get your foot in the door and join our supportive finance team. This is the ideal role to join us whilst we continue to grow!


Due to the high volume of applications we receive the vacancy close date may change, don't delay and APPLY NOW!


Please note we will not be accepting applicants put forward through agencies, if you are interested in the role please apply directly, we would love to hear from you!

839522957:
[

Retail Experience Lead

Company Name Bellroy Company Location Fitzroy, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 84 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you are a results-driven marketer with a deep knowledge of retail and its driving forces? We need you to help us devise new in-store experiences.


In a nutshell

At Bellroy, we put our heart, soul and countless design hours into helping the world carry better. Getting our products under people’s noses in a physical retail space is key to making this mission a success. Our retail presence (in 1200+ stores) is growing and we need a retail lead who can help spur our in-store conversions, and drive even faster retail growth.\xa0


As Bellroy’s go-to person for retail conversion, you’ll be involved in the marketing funnel for bricks and mortar retail at all levels, from strategy and planning, to implementation and results reporting. Starting with our highest leverage retailers, you'll look for new and innovative ways to achieve strong commercial outcomes, while maintaining our brand ideals.


You’ll report to our Creative Director, and work within our marketing team to nut out a plan, get it live, and then iterate as we learn more. And you will work closely with our wholesale and data teams to assess the performance of every activity. And then you’ll work with yourself to build a process that we can use for the months (years?) to come.\xa0


If you have a treasure chest full of marketing tools ready to apply in the retail space, please keep reading.


You might be the one if…


You’re fascinated by consumer psychology. You like to delve into your well-developed suite of marketing tools and figure out which one will work best at any given time, to cut through the noise and drive a sale.


You’ve probably been involved with retail from several angles, and proven time and time again you have a knack for marketing a brand. You might have gained that knack from studying it at uni and continuing on the path from there, or you might have realised it after working for retail brands in a different capacity for a few years. But you’ve been in marketing roles ever since, and you can’t imagine a better place for you. Especially when it’s the nitty gritty kind of marketing – you know, the kind that’s full of implementation and analysis?


You’re practical. Analytical. Reliable. You love to make things happen – action and outcomes are important to you. And delivering real projects that achieve commercial goals is what drives you. While you can think ‘blue sky’ when you need to, your favourite thing is to execute a project down to the finest detail, measure its effectiveness and then work to make it better next time.


You're comfortable with facts and figures, and use data to better inform your ideas and assess opportunities as they arise. But there’s a human side to what you do, which you can appreciate as much as you do the data. You’re figuring out how to make a human commit to a purchase, after all. You are a smart, no-nonsense kind of person, and that’s often what people love about you.


If you were here last week, here are some things you would have done...


  • Worked with our Creative Director and Global Sales Director to roadmap our retail strategy, from short-term activities to longer term goals

  • Reviewed the sales data from a recent activation, noting what worked well and what could be improved for next time

  • Worked with the data team and Global Sales Director to figure out how to measure the success of a retail activation you are planning

  • Worked with our digital marketing team to roll out a localised ad campaign for a new or important retailer

  • Worked with our digital and creative teams to analyse the strengths of our brand via our digital channels, and looked for ways to emulate this through physical stores

  • Got your geek on, reading ‘Why People Buy’ to brush up on your customer modelling

  • Prepared a report for the Exec Team on recent retail activations against pre-defined success criteria

  • Conducted a retrospective with the team on what worked and what could be improved next time

  • Gushed over a new store opening and shared your thoughts on why with the rest of the team


There are some skills you must possess:


  • 4–6 years experience in a similar role/field

  • A degree in marketing or business, or equivalent experience

  • Deep understanding of the workings of retail and/or wholesale relationships

  • An understanding of the customer experience in a retail environment

  • Experience with tactics and strategies used to drive conversions in a physical retail environment

  • Strong project management skills, with an understanding of the many stages of rolling out projects in-store

  • The ability to multitask and collaborate across many teams

  • Strategic thinking and the ability to assess opportunities from an ROI perspective

  • Clear communication skills, including the ability to help others understand a project’s objectives

The Contracts Administrator will manage all the contractual obligations of the Company for all incoming and outgoing transactions and analyse potential risks that contract changes may pose to the organisation.

Company Name Australian Volunteers Program Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Job description

We're looking for a\xa0Crop Production Advisor to work in Vietnam for 7 months. Click the 'Apply' button to learn more about the role.\xa0



The Australian Volunteers Program

\xa0

This Australian Government initiative has supported thousands of Australians to volunteer overseas as part of Australia’s aid program.

\xa0

We recruit a diverse range of skilled Australians to support partner organisations in our region to achieve their own development goals, because the most effective development is locally-led and locally-driven.

\xa0

From the time of selection as a volunteer, through to their return, Australian volunteers are well supported. Australian volunteers are supported with return airfares, living allowances, training and more. Partners and children can accompany an Australian volunteer on assignment. On longer assignments, financial support is available for partners/children who are Australian citizens or permanent residents.

\xa0

We’re looking for Australians with skills across a range of sectors including:

  • Health

  • Education and training

  • Community and social development

  • Communications and media\xa0

  • Business services, marketing and tourism

  • Disaster and emergency management Information technology

  • Agriculture, forestry and fisheries

  • Law and justice

  • Gender equality and child protection

  • Public policy, economics and financial management

  • Engineering

  • Skilled trades.


The opportunity

  • Spend 1-24 months living and working in one of 26 developing countries across our region

  • Work with United Nations agencies, NGOs, hospitals, universities, agribusinesses, government departments, small businesses and everything in-between

  • Make a difference through Australia’s aid program and contribute to sustainable international development

  • Join a community of thousands of returned volunteers who have been contributing to global development for over 60 years.


The support

  • Living and accommodation allowances

  • Comprehensive insurance, medical assessments and vaccinations \xa0

  • Pre-departure briefings, in-country orientation and language training

  • Ongoing in-country support from an experienced in-country management team

  • Access to 24-hour emergency support

  • Debriefing on return to Australia

  • Resettlement allowance on return to Australia (for assignments over 6 months duration).



VIEW OPPORTUNITIES BY CLICKING 'APPLY' ABOVE


  • Volunteer assignments are designed by our partner organisations overseas and advertised through the Australian Volunteers Program’s website

  • Australian citizens and permanent residents can apply for assignments that match their skill set and work experience

  • Shortlisted applicants will participate in an interview process online or over-the-phone.

  • Our program is inclusive and we encourage applicants with access requirements to contact our team via 1800 331 292 or info@australianvolunteers.com

  • View all assignments:\xa0www.australianvolunteers.com/opportunities/\xa0


Further information

\xa0

For more information on Australian Volunteers Program visit www.australianvolunteers.com or call 1800 331 292.

With our exponential growth, we are seeking a Senior Account Director to join our Melbourne team.\xa0 This person will be required to lead a team supporting a range of clients with creative, content and experiential requirements across all facets of our client marketing activities online and offline.\xa0 The successful candidate will have experience in the automotive sector.

About The Role

As Senior Account Director, your responsibilities will include:


  • Lead and manage the client and key stakeholders at a senior level\xa0
  • Day-to-day, short, mid and long-term planning of the client/s account including playing an active role in the ongoing and new business opportunities the account/s present
  • Generating sales and managing the client’s event / marketing expectations from inception to completion

Partnerships Manager

Company Name Medipass Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 62 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Medipass is one of Australia’s fastest growing fintechs, and is backed by NAB.

  • Help grow our partnerships with a range of healthcare providers, health funders and technology companies.

  • Based in Melbourne CBD.


About Medipass


At Medipass, we are passionate about improving the healthcare experience, with a specific focus on payments. The Australian healthcare system is currently highly manual and paper based, often leaving patients, health practitioners and health funders frustrated and looking for a better solution that is transparent, seamless and digital.


Our products drive financial transparency and control for patients, increase efficiency and billing simplicity for health practitioners and provide more valuable insights for health funders.


A better health system demands better ways to claim and pay; help us build that future.


Role description


As a fintech playing in the healthcare payment space, a core component of what makes us successful is our ability to nurture and develop trusting relationships with all our stakeholders. We are searching for an experienced candidate who will eagerly pick up a number of existing relationships and further develop these into strong partnerships.


This role will be responsible for a number of key relationships across a variety of groups such as Health Insurers, Practice Management Systems (and other software technology companies), and Providers.


Working closely with the rest of the Medipass team, this role will help personify the Medipass business as the go-to contact point for our key partners, ensuring their success and ours.


Key responsibilities of the Partnerships Manager are:

  • Develop and nurture existing partnerships, including all stakeholder engagement and management tasks;

  • Identify new opportunities to build and develop strategic partnerships;

  • Prepare regular account management sessions, providing updates on new developments and exploration of future opportunities - including the preparation of progress reports, key partner metrics, etc;

  • Provide a first point of contact for partner enquiries and be accountable for follow an issue or enquiry through to resolution, working closely with the Medipass team;

  • Assist with, and take ownership, of business proposal preparation;

  • Identify industry opportunities (eg. conferences and events) and co-ordinate Medipass’ participation and involvement;

  • Track, monitor and report on key relationships (ownership of key CRM activities);

  • Additional duties as necessary (we’re a startup, there will always be interesting opportunities for you to get involved in!).


About you


Our ideal candidate will have:

  • 3+ years of relevant experience in business development and account management roles;

  • Strong understanding of what it takes to bring a new product or business to market;

  • Track record of developing new partnerships built on mutual trust;


Nice to haves:

  • Health industry exposure and experience;

  • A payments / technology software background.

Company Name The College of Intuition Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Job description

Are you a Journalist that specialises in researching and communicating the latest in health & wellbeing topics such as body, mind & soul? We have a unique story that many people need to hear.
We are conducting ground-breaking research into the human higher sensory system and are looking to work with a Journalist that can assist us to get our story out to a large audience to attract a greater number of volunteers. The Sentient Experiment offers free higher sensory awareness training to people that identify with having empathic and intuitive abilities. The results of this training will assist us in researching more advanced training techniques to further understand, enhance and integrate the human sensory empathic and intuitive abilities for a larger number of people.

If you are interested in sharing our story, please contact us at enquiries@thesentientexperiment.com.au

Marketing Coordinator

Company Name Atlantic Group \xae Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 186 views

Job description

Make your mark with a true hospitality hybrid! Atlantic Group is renowned for world-class events and hospitality experiences; the brand portfolio spans events, destination catering, restaurants, bar ambience and retail offerings.


Proudly the black sheep. Atlantic Group is all about expansion – we don’t like confined spaces; reaching new heights – the ultimate thrill seeker; and innovation – no replicas allowed.


The OPPORTUNITY:


Join the [A] team as a confident and eager creative with an interest in marketing trends and a love for Melbourne’s thriving hospitality scene. Working within a motivated and creative team the successful candidate will assist with the implementation of an extensive marketing strategy that spans the entire Atlantic Group brand portfolio. The scope will include, but is not limited to:


  • Traffic all branding and collateral to marketing for review and final approval
  • Plan and execute campaigns to support business goals – from strategy to testing plan to execution and backend analytics to drive optimization and effectiveness
  • Manage campaign tracking by business groups to ensure accuracy and program ROI
  • Collaborate on integrated marketing plans to ensure all objective and/or initiatives are carried out
  • Lead content writing efforts to develop compelling social stories for all brands
  • Management of group social accounts and create and update content on websites
  • Drive engagement through a range of social media activities, event activations and local area marketing
  • Assist with marketing requirements for internal events
  • Assist in the creation of tailored sales proposals
  • Maintain customer databases and build relationships with key stakeholders

The EXPERTISE:

You will need to possess a strong sense of urgency, high attention to detail and solid communication skills. Other experience required is:

  • Degree or qualification in Marketing discipline or similar preferable
  • A minimum of 2 years demonstrated experience within the hospitality industry in a similar position and premium environment is preferred but not mandatory
  • Creative flair and imagination
  • Experience in executing marketing strategies to achieve business goals
  • Experience in developing promotional and marketing concepts and strategies that target key demographics
  • Experience in managing and maintaining social networking sites to ensure that marketing and promotional activities are maintained

If you are looking for a new opportunity and you have an appetite for Melbourne’s thriving hospitality and event scene….then apply now for this exciting and rewarding position!

Job description

McBride Charles Ryan (MCR) is an Architecture, Master Planning and Interior Design Studio\xa0recognised for its multi-award winning projects across a broad range of building types and scales.\xa0


MCR has an opportunity for a talented and motivated registered Architect. Revit experience is preferred as well as fluency in Rhino, AutoCAD, the Adobe Suite and Microsoft Office. Strong rendering skills would also be considered positively.\xa0


Our ideal Architect will have excellent detailing and construction knowledge and have a good understanding of building contracts, as well as confidence in preparing tender documentation, conducting site work and contract administration.\xa0


You will have excellent communication skills, a team oriented approach and the initiative to progress design concepts through concept, design development, contract documentation and contract administration phases.\xa0

This role will provide you with the opportunity to work with experienced studio Architects and allow you the scope to utilise your skills and understanding of the delivery of innovative design.\xa0


MCR has plans to move to an exciting new office near Chapel Street, Prahran this year. Salary will be commensurable with experience. We welcome your response, outlining your skills, experience and thoughts on how your abilities would add value to MCR’s practice.\xa0


Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia. Email your CV, sample portfolio (PDF Max 8MB) and covering letter to mail@mcbridecharlesryan.com.au. Please quote reference MCR ARCH_18 in the email subject
